text:
Costa Cordalis (, born Konstantinos Cordalis; 1 May 1944 – 2 July 2019) was a Greek-German schlager singer. He was born in Elateia, Phthiotis, Greece and moved to Germany in his teenage years. His 1976 song "Anita" was a chart success, reaching the top ten in Germany, Switzerland and Austria. In 2004, he won the reality television game show "Ich bin ein Star – Holt mich hier raus!". He also competed for Greece at the FIS Nordic World Ski Championships in 1985.
Cordalis was married and had three children. His son, Lucas, is also a singer. Cordalis lived in Santa Ponsa, Mallorca, Spain. He died in Mallorca on 2 July 2019, at the age of 75.
